text.p: Tropical Cyclone Freda, with 75 mph winds, is in the soutern Pacific near 28s/178e, moving south at 13 mph. It is expected to weaken this period. It continues to threaten shipping during the next day or two. It may threaten northern New Zealand later in the period.
Tropical Cyclone Gretelle, with 55 mph winds, is near 26s/36e in the southern Mozambique Channel, moving west at 4 mph. It should remain over water this period.
Tropical Cyclone Pancho-Helinda, with 50 mph winds, is near 10s/91e in the Indian Ocean, moving north at 9 mph. It will turn to the west and strengthen this period.
Tropical Cyclone Iletta, with 35 mph winds, is near 17s/71e. This system should weaken and dissipate within the next 24 hours.
There are no further statements at this time.
